Some reported materials indicating the occurring of 12-hydroxystearic acid in castor oil are not scientifically correct. In fact, 12-hydroxystearic acid can be obtained from the hydrogenated castor oil (Ishchuk 2005). 12-hydroxystearic acid is used as surfactant and cleansing agent (Gottschalck and Bailey 2008). 12-hydroxystearic acid is a synthetic material (not found in nature and not a source of a natural product); therefore, it will not be considered as a NHP, but a drug or a non-medicinal ingredient.";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"77457";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:22:"12-Hydroxystearic acid";s:5:"title";s:22:"12-Hydroxystearic acid";s:3:"nid";s:5:"81273";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:81274;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:7:"381;103";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:99:"A non-NHP because not a naturally occurring substance included in Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:129:"Un non PSN parce que n'est pas une substance naturelle comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1862:"Hyoscine butylbromide is a derivative of the tertiary ammonium compound hyoscine. Hyoscine is an alkaloid present in plant genera of the family Solanaceae such as Datura, Duboisia, Hyoscyamus and Scopoliawhich grow in many countries. It is chemically processed by adding a butyl group to obtain a quaternary ammonium structure. This modification results in a molecule that still has anticholinergic activities comparable to those of hyoscine. But, in contrast with hyoscine, quaternary compounds such as hyoscine butylbromide should not be systemically absorbed. Limited systemic absorption may improve the adverse events profile compared with the parent compound hyoscine.  The main pharmacokinetic feature of quaternary ammonium derivatives is their poor systemic availability after enteral administration. The quaternisation of the ammonium group leads to a large molecule with a positive charge that is barely absorbed from the gut lumen. This results in local availability of the active compound and antagonism of the action of acetylcholine at local muscarinic receptors. Confirmation that oral hyoscine butylbromide is poorly absorbed is supported by the results of several pharmacokinetic studies in humans. The majority of these data have been obtained from the manufacturer. In these studies, oral hyoscine butylbromide was administered at dose levels ranging from 40 to 500mg. Since the intent of derivitization of Hyoscine to Hyoscine n-Butylbromide is to reduce the systemic absorption, improve delivery of the drug to the gastrointestinal tract, thus changing the pharmacokinetics, and reduce the adverse events profile compared to the parent compound hyoscine thus changing the toxicology, Hyoscine n-Butylbromide is not acting as a source of hyoscine and it differs significantly in its pharmacology, so it is classified as a drug and not an NHP.";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"77459";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:29:"N-Butylscopolammonium Bromide";s:5:"title";s:29:"N-Butylscopolammonium Bromide";s:3:"nid";s:5:"81274";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:81275;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:3:"381";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:99:"A non-NHP because not a naturally occurring substance included in Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:129:"Un non PSN parce que n'est pas une substance naturelle comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:699:"There are three forms of hesperidin; hesperidin complex, purified hesperidin and hesperidin methylchalcone. Hesperidin is considered as a NHP since it is isolated from sweet orange. However, Hesperidin methylchalcone that is manufactured from hesperidine in two steps; alkaline treatment followed by a methylation process in which during these two processes the hesperidine chemical structure is irreversibly converted to an open chain (containing chalcone moiety) structure (see below) which is totally different structure than hesperidine. Hesperidin methylchalcone is neither found in nature nor can be converted to the hesperidine moiety and therefore it will be considered as a drug, not a NHP.";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"77460";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:25:"Hesperidin methylchalcone";s:5:"title";s:25:"Hesperidin methylchalcone";s:3:"nid";s:5:"81275";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:81276;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:3:"381";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:99:"A non-NHP because not a naturally occurring substance included in Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:129:"Un non PSN parce que n'est pas une substance naturelle comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:507:"1-(3-methoxyphenyl)ethylamine is a useful intermediate in pharmaceutical industry. It can be prepared by chemical synthesis [1]. Although a commercial product (named DREN or DRENBUTEROL) containing this ingredient is claimed to be a mesolimbic beta agonist fat burning agent([2] and many other commercial web sites), no scientific reference(s) could be located. BMOV is synthesized by a simple metathesis of vanadyl sulfate trihydrate and Maltol. [Thompson, 1999]. Vanadyl sulfate (VS) is an NHP according to the Ingredient Classification Database and Maltol is a naturally occurring organic compound found in the bark of the larch tree and is isolated from Passiflora incarnata [PubChem].

One study used 48 V (Vanadium radio-isotope) as a tracer and showed that 48 V-BMOV had enhanced uptake and slower excretion than 48 VS and tissue distribution patterns of 48 V-BMOV differed from 48 VS, with relatively higher 48 V liver-to-kidney ratio for the organovanadium complex. Concentrations of 48 V in the kidney were 3 times higher and in the Liver were 4 times higher when 48 V-BMOV was administered as compared to 48 VS [Setyawati, 1998]. In a study looking at the interaction of BMOV with serum proteins, the interaction of BMOV with serum albumin appears to result in slightly different reaction products than Vanadium Oxide Sulfate (VOSO 4) [Liboiron, 2005].

Based on the difference in the pharmacokinetic profile of Bis(maltolato)oxovanadium IV to vanadyl sulfate, Bis(maltolato)oxovanadium IV is not considered an NHP, nor as a source of an NHP.";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"77471";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:29:"Bis(maltolato)oxovanadium(IV)";s:5:"title";s:29:"Bis(maltolato)oxovanadium(IV)";s:3:"nid";s:5:"81286";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:81287;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:3:"463";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:99:"A non-NHP because not a naturally occurring substance included in Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:129:"Un non PSN parce que n'est pas une substance naturelle comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:978:"Tykerb, also known as lapatinib or N--[3-Chloro-4-[(3-fluorophenyl)methoxy]phenyl]-6-[5-[[[2-(methylsulfonyl)ethyl]amino]methyl]-2-furanyl]-4-quinazolinamine (CAS no. 231277-92-2) is an antineoplastic reversible dual inhibitor of ErbB1 and ErbB2 tyrosine kinases [Merck, 2006]. Lapatinib was developed based on the observation that overexpression of EGFR and HER2 in a range of cancers, it is used with the medicine capecitabine for the treatment of patients with advanced or metastatic breast cancer, and who have already had certain other breast cancer treatments. . Drugs such as trastuzumab and erlotinib were developed to inhibit EGFR kinase and based on the characteristics of signalling within the EGFR family, it was hypothesized that a more effective anticancer agent would be a molecule that could inhibit both EGFR and HER2. On doit noter que cet ingrédient est soumis à des exigences réglementaires additionnelles conformément aux Réglements sur les précurseurs à cause de sa présence à l'Annexe VI Partie 1 de la Loi réglementant certaines drogues et autres substances.";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:699:"Although there are two references indicating that acetic anhydride is found in watercress Nasturtium officinale (DNP 2009) and in watercress (Naturtium officinale r. br.) (Burdock 2005), it is well known that acetic anhydride is not stable in water and reacts with the moisture in the air to produce acetic acid and therefore, it is unlikely to be found as stable substance in plants. Acetic anhydride is produced by carbonylation of methyl acetate or by the reaction of ketene with acetic acid.Note that this substance, being outlined in Schedule VI of the CDSA, could also be subject to additional regulatory requirements in accordance with the Precursor Control Regulations (Justice Canada 2002).";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"77480";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:16:"Acetic anhydride";s:5:"title";s:16:"Acetic anhydride";s:3:"nid";s:5:"81295";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:81296;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:3:"465";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:326:"A non-NHP because not a naturally occurring substance included in Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations. (Kameoka et al. 1991), Pyysalo 1976 and Kameoka et al. 1991 identified (in the experimental and materials/methods section, respectively), this is likely an artifact since diethyl ether/ether is used as one of the solvents in the preparation of the samples analyzed. Diethyl ether, also known as ether, is a common laboratory solvent used for extraction and in synthesis. It can be prepared both in laboratories and on an industrial scale by mixing ethanol with a strong acid, typically sulfuric acid.

As such, this compound has been studied experimentally for its effect(s) on fatty acid metabolism (Granlund et al. 2005, Larsen et al. 2005, Vaagenes et al. 1999); as well as clinically, formulated with many other ingredients in a weight loss supplement, for its thermogenic effects (Hoffman et al. 2009).   The first three references outlined above, in combination with Spydevold and Bremer (1989), indicates that Methyl TTA is obtained through the reaction between tetradecylbromide and thiolactic acid.  The other reference (i.e. Hoffman et al. 2009) seems to correlate Methyl TTA (erroneously interchange with TTA in the article) with herbal and botanical ingredients.  However, evidences on the natural occurrence of Methyl TTA have not been found.  Consequently,  Methyl tetradecylthioacetic acid does not meet the substance aspect of the natural health product definition, as outlined in the NHP Regulations (Justice Canada 2009).";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"77526";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:38:"alpha-Methyl tetradecylthioacetic acid";s:5:"title";s:38:"alpha-Methyl tetradecylthioacetic acid";s:3:"nid";s:5:"81317";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:81318;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:3:"877";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:99:"A non-NHP because not a naturally occurring substance included in Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:129:"Un non PSN parce que n'est pas une substance naturelle comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:851:"Benzophenone-5 is the sodium salt of Benzophenone-4 (Gottschalck and Bailey 2008; US-NLM 2009). Benzophenone-4 is approved by the FDA for use as safe and effective OTC sunscreen ingredient at concentration equal or greater than the one used in cosmetics, i.e. ≥ 0.3% (CIR 2009) but should not be more than 10% (Steinberg 1996). It is a powerful emetic and has been used for that effect in acute poisoning (as emetic). It has also been used in the diagnosis and treatment of parkinsonism, but its adverse effects limit its use (SPS 1995; US-NLM 2009). Apomorphine is also among a wide range of drugs that has been used in the management of erectile dysfunction (Sweetman 2009). It is not indicated as a controlled drug substance (Department-of-Justice-Canada 1996). Apomorphine is a synthetic substance prepared by treating morphine with concentrated hydrochloric acid (Merck 2009). There are fundamental differences between the structure of morphine and apomorphine. Moreover, apomorphine is not a source for any natural product. It is mostly used in opthalmic and topical products (Blasco 1994).Sulfacetamide sodium will be considered as a drug, since it does not occur naturally.";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"77533";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:30:"Sulfacetamide sodium anhydrous";s:5:"title";s:30:"Sulfacetamide sodium anhydrous";s:3:"nid";s:5:"81324";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:81325;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:4:"1127";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:100:"A non-NHP because not a naturally occurring substance included in Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations.";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:129:"Un non PSN parce que n'est pas une substance naturelle comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1722:"Phenibut (PB),  is a chiral molecule which only R -Phenibut is active (Dambrova, Zvejniece et al. 2008). It  was synthesized in 1960’s by Perekalin and his associates at the Department of Organic Chemistry of the Herzen Pedagogic, Institute in St. Petersburg, Russia. Incorporation of a phenyl ring into the GABA molecule improve the entry of the molecule into the brain. For example, following incorporation, researchers demonstrated that in mice and rats, PB penetrates the blood-brain barrier significantly better than GABA. Unlike GABA, PB completely lacks anticonvulsant activity by either systemic or intracerebroventricular administration. The lack of anticonvulsant activity of PB may be related to the reduction in norepinephrine-independent [3H]-GABA binding to brain synaptic membranes by β-substituted GABA derivatives. In addition, certain neuropharmacological effects of GABA were lost with β-substitution (Lapin 2001). Compared to GABA, Phenibut has pronounced neuropsychopharmacological effects including nootropic, tranquilizing, and anxiolytic activity. It was found recently that PB has also a strong immunocorrective activity (Tyurenkov and Samotrueva 2009). Unlike GABA, following intravenous administration to either rabbits or rats, PB is not metabolized but largely excreted in the urine. The acidity of GABA and PB are also different; PH of 5 for GABA and around 2.5 for PB (Merck 2009). In summary, Phenibut have different pharmacological, bioavailability, absorption and physical properties than GABA. Phenibut is not naturally occurring compound. It is neither a derivative of GABA, nor a source for any natural products including GABA. Phenibut will not be considered as a NHP, but a drug.";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"77534";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:8:"Phenibut";s:5:"title";s:8:"Phenibut";s:3:"nid";s:5:"81325";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:81326;a:12:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:4:"1312";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:100:"A non-NHP because not a naturally occurring substance included in Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations.";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:129:"Un non PSN parce que n'est pas une substance naturelle comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"77535";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:19:"7-Methoxyisoflavone";s:5:"title";s:19:"7-Methoxyisoflavone";s:3:"nid";s:5:"81326";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2013-10-16";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:81327;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:4:"2342";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:100:"A non-NHP because not a naturally occurring substance included in Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations.";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:129:"Un non PSN parce que n'est pas une substance naturelle comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:713:"N,N′-bis(2-mercaptoethyl)isophthalamide (also known as 1,3-benzenediamidoethanethiol or BDETH2) is a chemical compound that has been designed and synthesized for its use as a precipitation agent for the removal of soft metals from water (Zaman 2008, Zaman et al. 2007).  Indeed, BDETH2  has shown effectiveness at removing metals from water and in producing non-leaching precipitates, as well as in metal removal from gold mining effluent, lead battery recycling, and acid mine drainage (Matlock et al. 2003). Since BDETH2 has not been found to occur in nature, it does not meet the substance aspect of the Natural Health Product (NHP) definition, as outlined in the NHP Regulations (Government of Canada comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1004:"Lacosamide is a synthetic, functionalized amino acid possessing anticonvulsant and analgesic properties, through its ability to enhance slow activation of voltage-gated sodium channels and to bind to collapsing response mediator protein-2 (O’Neil et al. 2010). It is used, mostly orally but also by intravenous infusion, in the treatment of epilepsy as an adjunctive therapy for partial seizures with or without secondary generalisation (Sweetman 2010, Beyreuther et al. 2007). When given orally, Lacosamide is rapidly and completely absorbed, then almost exclusively excreted in the urine unchanged or as its O-desmethyl metabolite (Cross and Curran 2009, Doty et al. 2007).
Based on the above, Lacosamide does not meet the substance aspect of the natural health product (NHP) definition, as outlined in the Natural Health Products Regulations (Government of Canada 2010); nor considered as a derivative of any NHP substance, as defined in the Product Licensing guidance document (Health Canada comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1366:"Febuxostat is a non-purine selective inhibitor of xanthine oxidase. Uric acid is the end product of purine metabolism generated during the enzymatic degradation of hypoxanthine and xanthine It is generated in the cascade of Hypoxanthine to Xanthine to Uric acid. Both steps in the above transformations are catalyzed by xanthine oxidase. Febuxostat decreases serum uric acid by selectively inhibiting xanthine oxidase (2).
Uric acid metabolism and sites of action of febuxostat (xanthine oxidase inhibitor*).
Febuxostat is known to synthesize starting from 4-Nitrobenzonitrile (3).
Since Febuxostat is a synthetic product that is not found in nature, it will be considered as a drug, not a NHP.

sexuelles sont présentes sur la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:562:"Pregnenolone, like DHEA, is a steroidal hormone manufactured in the body. Pregnenolone is a precursor hormone synthesized from cholesterol, principally in the adrenal glands, but also in the liver, skin, brain, testicles, ovaries, and retina of the eyes. Pregnenolone is considered as the grand precursor for almost all of the other steroid hormones including DHEA, progesterone, testosterone, the estrogens, and cortisol. Since pregnenolone is included in the sex hormones of the Schedule F to the Food and Drug Regulations, it is considered as a drug, not De plus, n'est pas une substance naturelle comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:649:"Ranitidine is a histamine H2-receptor antagonist which inhibits the production of stomach acid, it is used for the treatment of peptic ulcer disease and gastroesophageal reflux disease.  This product is currently marketed by the company GlaxoSmithKline under the brand name Zantac, which is actually the hydrochloride salt of Ranitidine, Ranitidine hydrochloride.  It was developped by the company Glaxo, which is now GlaxoSmithKline, using a model of the histamine H2-receptor and quantitative structure-activity relationships.  Since Ranitidine is a synthetically prepared compound, not found in nature, it will be considered as a drug, not a la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance : Hormones corticosurrénales, leurs sels ou dérivés";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:676:"Adrenosterone is an aromatase (estrogen synthetase) inhibitor and a male sex hormone (Numazawa, Mutsumi et al. 1996; CRC-DNP 2009). It was isolated from the adrenal cortex. Adrenosterone occurs in humans as well as most mammals and is the primary androgenic precursor in fish. It is a steroid hormone with weak androgenic effect. Since androgens are classified as ‘Adrenocortical hormones’ (Gard 2001), Adrenosterone is considered as an adrenocotical hormone. Adrenocortical hormones are listed in schedule F as follow (Justice 2009):“Adrenocortical hormones and their salts and derivatives”. Adrenosterone will not be considered as a NHP, but a schedule F ingredient.";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"77491";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:13:"Adrenosterone";s:5:"title";s:13:"Adrenosterone";s:3:"nid";s:5:"81921";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-02-04";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:81922;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:9:"661;17412";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:91:"A non-NHP because listed in the Prescription Drug List as follows: Pilocarpine or its salts";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:102:"Un non PSN à cause de sa présence sur la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance :  Pilocarpine ou ses sels";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:379:"Pilocarpine (CAS # 92-13-7) is an alkaloid isolated from Pilocarpus microphyllus and several other Pilocarpus spp. (Rutaceae) (ChemID Plus, DNP).

sels";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"76678";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:9:"Aztreonam";s:5:"title";s:9:"Aztreonam";s:3:"nid";s:5:"82248";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-02-05";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:82249;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"17412";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:79:"A non-NHP because listed in the Prescription Drug List as follows: Fluconazole.";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:90:"Un non PSN à cause de sa présence sur la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance : Fluconazole.";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:975:"Fluconazole is a triazole antifungal agent that is used to treat oropharyngeal candidiasis, cryptococcal meningitis in AIDS and also in the treatment and prevention of superficial and systemic fungal infections [1-3]. Fluconazole is a synthetic drug made by many pharmaceutical companies including Pfizer (as Diflucan) [4]. It is structurally related to imidazole-derivative azole antifungal agents (e.g. Clotrimazole). However, Fluconazole contains triazole ring (instead of imidazole) which results in increased antifungal activity [5]. Several synthetic methods for the preparation of Fluconazole have been reported [6]. Fluconazole is not naturally occuring. Currently, it is listed in Schedule F. Fluconazole will not be considered as a NHP, but a drug.
[1] ChemID
[2] The Merck Index
[3] Martindale: The complete drug reference
[4] www.pfizer.com/files/products/uspi_diflucan.pdf
[5] AHFS Drug Information 
[6] Chloralformamide";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"76765";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:16:"Chloralformamide";s:5:"title";s:16:"Chloralformamide";s:3:"nid";s:5:"82333";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-02-05";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:82334;a:12:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:10:"4311;17412";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:953:"A non-NHP because listed in the Prescription Drug List as follows: Nicotine or its salts, for human use, except (a) in natural substances; (b) in the form of a chewing gum containing 4 mg or less of nicotine per dosage unit; (c) in the form of a transdermal patch with a delivery rate of 22 mg or less of nicotine per day; (d) in a form to be administered orally by means of an inhalation device delivering 4 mg or less of nicotine per dosage unit; or (e) in the form of a lozenge containing 4 mg or less of nicotine per dosage unit. The listing of Nicotine in the Prescription Drug List exempts nicotine or its salts for human use, in natural substances. The Tobacco Act excludes drugs that contain nicotine to which the Food and Drugs Act applies. This means that natural substances containing nicotine that meet the definition of a natural health product, such as tabacum homeopathic medicines, are subject to the Natural Health Products Regulations.";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:1135:"Un non PSN à cause de sa présence sur la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance: Nicotine ou ses sels, destinés à l'usage humain, sauf : a) dans les substances naturelles; b) sous forme de gomme à mâcher contenant 4 mg ou moins de nicotine par unité posologique; c) sous forme de timbre cutané ayant un taux de libération de 22 mg ou moins de nicotine par jour; d) sous une forme destinée à être administrée par voie orale au moyen d’un inhalateur libérant 4 mg ou moins de nicotine par unité posologique; e) sous forme de pastille contenant 4 mg ou moins de nicotine par unité posologique. La présence de la Nicotine sur la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance exempte la nicotine ou ses sels destinés à l'usage humain dans les substances naturelles. La Loi sur le tabac exclut les drogues contenant de la nicotine auxquelles s'applique la Loi sur les aliments et les drogues. Ceci veut dire que les subtances naturelles contenant de la nicotine qui respectent la définition d'un produit de santé naturel, tel que les médicaments homéopathiques de tabacum, sont sujets au Règlement sur les produits de santé This immunosuppressive agent is currently approved for use in rheumatoid arthritis.  Since immunizing agents and drugs obtained by recombinant DNA procedures (fusion proteins are obtained by recombinant DNA procedures) are listed in Schedule D to the Food and Drugs Act, Abatacept will be considered as a non-NHP, a Schedule D substance.";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"76540";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:9:"Abatacept";s:5:"title";s:9:"Abatacept";s:3:"nid";s:5:"82443";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-02-11";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:82444;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:10:"3213;17412";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:281:"A non-NHP because it is an enzyme obtained via recombinant DNA procedure, which falls under "Drugs Obtained By Recombinant DNA Procedures" listed in Schedule D of the Food and Drugs Act. Since drugs obtained by recombinant DNA procedures are listed in Schedule D to the Food and Drugs Act; and that drugs administered by puncturing the dermis are excluded from NHP Regulations by being captured in Schedule 2, Alglucosidase alfa will be considered as a Schedule D substance.";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"76541";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:18:"Alglucosidase alfa";s:5:"title";s:18:"Alglucosidase alfa";s:3:"nid";s:5:"82444";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-02-11";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:82445;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:5:"17412";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:97:"A non-NHP because listed in the Prescription Drug List as follows: Paclitaxel and its derivatives";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:105:"Un non PSN à cause de sa présence sur la Liste des drogues sur ordonnance : Paclitaxel et ses dérivés";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:1065:"Paclitaxel (more commonly known as Taxol) is a naturally occurring substance, which has been isolated from the stem bark of the Pacific yew tree, Taxus brevifolia, and in traces amounts in other plants and fungi.  Currently, most Paclitaxel production is accomplished by a plant cell fermentation technology or by a semi-synthetic route starting with 10-Deacetylbaccatin III, since this naturally occurring compound can be isolated in larger quantities than Paclitaxel.  Despite the fact that Paclitaxel is a naturally occurring compound, it is listed in Schedule F to the Food and Drug Regulations; therefore, it will be considered as a Schedule F drug, not a NHP. l’ADN";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:6:"107095";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:11:"Apoaequorin";s:20:"field_limitation_ref";s:4:"NHPD";s:5:"title";s:11:"Apoaequorin";s:3:"nid";s:5:"82455";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-06-26";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:82457;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:16:"87;67;3946;22702";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:1349:"Petrolatum is a non-NHP because it is not falling under Schedule 1 to the NHP Regulations.  If petrolatum is declared as a medicinal ingredient in a product, the product is a drug, not an NHP. A Drug Identification Number Application should be submitted to Health Canada for this product.

If petrolatum is 1) declared as a non-medicinal ingredient and 2) is present at a concentration that is less than 30%, the product is an NHP.  A Natural Health Product Licence Application should be submitted to Health Canada for this product.

If petrolatum is 1) declared as a non-medicinal ingredient and 2) is present at a concentration that is greater than or equal to 30% and 3) it contributes to the claim (e.g. the Recommended Use or Purpose on the product is a statement to the effect of those permitted for petrolatum on the Diaper Rash Products or Medicated Skin Care Products monographs), then the product is considered a drug.  A Drug Identification Number Application should be submitted to Health Canada for this product.

If petrolatum is 1) declared as a non-medicinal ingredient and 2) is present at a concentration that is greater than or equal to 30% and 3) does not contribute to the claim (as defined above), the product is an NHP.  A Natural Health Product Licence Application should be submitted to Health Canada for this product.";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:1667:"Le pétrolatum est un non-PSN puisqu'il n'est pas une substance décrite sous l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels.  Si le pétrolatum est déclaré comme ingrédient médicinal dans un produit, ce produit est une drogue, et non un PSN.  Une demande pour obtenir un numéro d'identification de médicament (DIN) doit être soumise à Santé Canada pour un tel produit.

Si le pétrolatum est 1) déclaré comme un ingrédient non médicinal et 2) est présent à une concentration qui est inférieure à 30%, le produit est un PSN.  Une demande de licence de mise en marché pour un produit de santé naturel doit être soumise à Santé Canada pour un tel produit.

Si le pétrolatum est 1) déclaré comme ingrédient non médicinal et 2) est présent à une concentration qui est supérieure ou égale à 30% et 3) qu'il contribue à l'allégation (p. ex. l'usage ou la fin recommandé pour le produit est un énoncé qui est comparable à ceux permis pour le pétrolatum  dans les monographies pour les produits de traitement de l'érythème fessier ou des produits médicamenteux pour le soin de la peau), ce produit est une drogue.  Une demande pour obtenir un numéro d'identification de médicament (DIN) doit être soumise à Santé Canada pour un tel produit.

Si le pétrolatum est 1) déclaré comme ingrédient non médicinal et 2) est présent à une concentration supérieure ou égale à 30% et 3) qu'il ne contribute pas à l'allégation (comme définie ci-haut), ce produit est un PSN.  Une demande de licence de mise en marché pour un produit de santé naturel doit être soumise à Santé Canada pour un tel produit.";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:745:"At any concentration where Petrolatum is associated with a health claim (e.g. as a barrier in diaper rash products), petrolatum is classified as a drug medicinal ingredient subject to the Food and Drug Regulations, not an NHP, because petroleum products are not captured in Schedule 1 to the Natural Health Products Regulations.
Pour toutes les concentrations où le pétrolatum est associé à une allégation santé (e.g. comme barrière dans les produits de traitement de l'érythème fessier), le pétrolatum est classifié comme une drogue médicinale sujette au Règlement sur les aliments et les drogues, et non un PSN, parce que les produits de pétrolatum ne font pas partie de l'Annexe 1 du Règlement des produits de santé naturels.";s:16:"field_legacy_nid";s:5:"76353";s:14:"field_workflow";s:9:"Published";s:30:"field_approved_ingredient_name";s:10:"Petrolatum";s:5:"title";s:10:"Petrolatum";s:3:"nid";s:5:"82457";s:7:"changed";s:10:"2014-10-10";s:14:"workflow_state";s:9:"Published";}i:82458;a:13:{s:4:"body";s:0:"";s:21:"field_ingredient_role";s:2:"NN";s:13:"field_its_ids";s:10:"3946;22702";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_e";s:1385:"White petrolatum is a non-NHP because it is not falling under Schedule 1 to the NHP Regulations. If Mineral oil is declared as a medicinal ingredient in a product, the product is a drug, not an NHP. A Drug Identification Number Application should be submitted to Health Canada for this product.

If mineral oil is 1) declared as a non-medicinal ingredient and 2) is present at a concentration that is less than 50% (or less than 30% when in combination with colloidal oatmeal), the product is an NHP.  A Natural Health Product Licence Application should be submitted to Health Canada for this product.

If mineral oil is 1) declared as a non-medicinal ingredient and 2) is present at a concentration that is greater than or equal to 50% (or greater than or equal to 30% when in combination with colloidal oatmeal) and 3) it contributes to the claim (e.g. the Recommended Use or Purpose on the product is a statement to the effect of those permitted for mineral oil on the Diaper Rash Products or Medicated Skin Care Products monographs), then the product is considered a drug.  A Drug Identification Number Application should be submitted to Health Canada for this product.

A Natural Health Product Licence Application should be submitted to Health Canada for this product.";s:25:"field_non_nhp_rationale_f";s:1981:"L'huile minérale est un non-PSN puisqu'il n'est pas une substance décrite sous l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels.  Si l'huile minérale est déclaré comme ingrédient médicinal dans un produit, ce produit est une drogue, et non un PSN.  Une demande pour obtenir un numéro d'identification de médicament (DIN) doit être soumise à Santé Canada pour un tel produit.

Si l'huile minérale est 1) déclaré comme un ingrédient non médicinal et 2) est présent à une concentration qui est inférieure à 50% (ou supérieure ou égale à 30% lorsqu'il est en combinaison avec la farine d'avoine colloïdale), le produit est un PSN.  Une demande de licence de mise en marché pour un produit de santé naturel doit être soumise à Santé Canada pour un tel produit.

Si l'huile minérale est 1) déclaré comme ingrédient non médicinal et 2) est présent à une concentration qui est supérieure ou égale à 50% (ou supérieure ou égale à 30% lorsqu'il est en combinaison avec la farine d'avoine colloïdale) et 3) qu'il contribue à l'allégation (p. ex. l'usage ou la fin recommandé pour le produit est un énoncé qui est comparable à ceux permis pour l'huile minérale dans les monographies pour les produits de traitement de l'érythème fessier ou des produits médicamenteux pour le soin de la peau), ce produit est une drogue.  Une demande pour obtenir un numéro d'identification de médicament (DIN) doit être soumise à Santé Canada pour un tel produit.

Si l'huile minérale est 1) déclaré comme ingrédient non médicinal et 2) est présent à une concentration supérieure ou égale à 50% (ou supérieure ou égale à 30% lorsqu'il est en combinaison avec la farine d'avoine colloïdale) et 3) qu'il ne contribute pas à l'allégation (comme définie ci-haut), ce produit est un PSN.  Une demande de licence de mise en marché pour un produit de santé naturel doit être soumise à Santé Canada pour un tel produit.";s:19:"field_old_rationale";s:657:"A non-NHP because not a naturally occurring substance included in Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations.
Un non PSN parce que n'est pas une substance naturelle comprise dans l'Annexe 1 du Règlement sur les produits de santé naturels.
Mineral oil (liquid petrolatum) is a by-product obtained when petroleum (which exists in the upper strata of some areas of the Earth's crust) is distilled to produce gasoline. It is composed mainly of alkanes and cyclic paraffins. Since petroleum products contain some residual toxic ingredients and the petroleum are not captured in the Schedule 1 of the NHP Regulations, Mineral oil will be considered as drug, not a
